properties.author: Mike Schachter
properties.title: The Struts Framework Project - Form Tags

info.p: This taglib contains tags used to create struts input forms.
Renders an HTML <input> element of type button, populated from the specified value or the content of this tag body. This tag is only valid when nested inside a form tag body.

attribute.name: accesskey
attribute.info: The keyboard character used to move focus immediately to this element.

attribute.name: onblur
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses input focus.

attribute.name: onchange
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses input focus and its value has changed.

attribute.name: onclick
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives a mouse click.

attribute.name: ondblclick
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives a mouse double click.

attribute.name: onfocus
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives input focus.

attribute.name: onkeydown
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and a key is depressed.

attribute.name: onkeypress
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and a key is depressed and released.

attribute.name: onkeyup
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and a key is released.

attribute.name: onmousedown
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under the mouse pointer and a mouse button is depressed.

attribute.name: onmousemove
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under the mouse pointer and the pointer is moved.

attribute.name: onmouseout
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element was under the mouse pointer but the pointer was moved outside the element.

attribute.name: onmouseover
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element was not under the mouse pointer but the pointer is moved inside the element.

attribute.name: onmouseup
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under the mouse pointer and a mouse button is released.

attribute.name: property
attribute.info: Name of the request parameter that will be included with this submission, set to the specified value.

attribute.name: style
attribute.info: CSS styles to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: tabindex
attribute.info: The tab order (ascending positive integers) for this element.

attribute.name: value
attribute.info: Value of the label to be placed on this button. This value will also be submitted as the value of the specified request parameter. [Body of this tag (if any), or "Click"]

info.p: Renders an HTML <input> element of type submit. This tag is only valid when nested inside a form tag body. Pressing of this submit button causes the action servlet to bypass calling the associated form bean validate() method. The action is called normally.

info.p: Renders an HTML <input> element of type checkbox, populated from the specified value or the specified property of the bean associated with our current form. This tag is only valid when nested inside a form tag body.

attribute.name: accesskey
attribute.info: The keyboard character used to move focus immediately to this element.

attribute.name: name
attribute.info: The attribute name of the bean whose properties are consulted when rendering the current value of this input field. If not specified, the bean associated with the form tag we are nested within is utilized.

attribute.name: onblur
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses input focus.

tag.name: file
tag.summary: Render A File Select Input Field

info.p: Renders an HTML <input> element of type file, defaulting to the specified value or the specified property of the bean associated with our current form. This tag is only valid when nested inside a form tag body.

attribute.name: accesskey
attribute.info: The keyboard character used to move focus immediately to this element.

attribute.name: accept
attribute.info: Comma-delimited set of content types that the server you submit to knows how to process. This list can be used by the client browser to limit the set of file options that is made available for selection. If not specified, no content type list will be sent.

attribute.name: maxlength
attribute.info: Maximum number of input characters to accept. [No limit]

attribute.name: name
attribute.info: The attribute name of the bean whose properties are consulted when rendering the current value of this input field. If not specified, the bean associated with the form tag we are nested within is utilized.

attribute.name: onblur
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses input focus.

attribute.name: onchange
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses input focus and its value has changed.

attribute.name: onclick
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives a mouse click.

attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and a key is depressed.

attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element was not under the mouse pointer but the pointer is moved inside the element.

attribute.name: onmouseup
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under the mouse pointer and a mouse button is released.

attribute.name: property
attribute.info: Name of the request parameter that will be included with this submission, set to the specified value.

attribute.name: style
attribute.info: CSS styles to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: tabindex
attribute.info: The tab order (ascending positive integers) for this element.

attribute.name: value
attribute.info: Value of the label to be placed on this button. This value will also be submitted as the value of the specified request parameter. [Body of this tag (if any), or "Cancel"]

info.p: Renders an HTML <form> element whose contents are described by the body content of this tag. The form implicitly interacts with the specified request scope or session scope bean to populate the input fields with the current property values from the bean.

attribute.name: action
attribute.info: The URL to which this form will be submitted. Typically, this will match a mapping for the ActionServlet managing this application. URL rewriting will automatically be performed on this URL, to maintain session state in the absence of cookies. [Form will be submitted to this page itself]

attribute.name: enctype
attribute.info: The content encoding to be used to submit this form, if the method is POST. This must be set to "multipart/form-data" if you are using the file tag to enable file upload. If not specified, the browser default (normally "application/x-www-form-urlencoded") is used.

attribute.name: focus
attribute.info: The field name (among the fields on this form) to which initial focus will be assigned with a JavaScript function. If not specified, no special JavaScript for this purpose will be rendered.

attribute.name: method
attribute.info: The HTTP method that will be used to submit this request (GET, POST). [POST]

attribute.name: name
attribute.info: Name of the request scope or session scope bean (as defined by the scope attribute) whose properties will be used to populate input field values. If no such bean is found, a new bean will be created (and added to the appropriate scope), using the Java class name specified by the type attribute.

attribute.name: onreset
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed if the form is reset.

attribute.name: onsubmit
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed if the form is submitted.

attribute.name: scope
attribute.info: JSP scope within which the associated bean will be accessed or created (request, session). [session]

attribute.name: style
attribute.info: CSS styles to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: target
attribute.info: Window target to which this form is submitted, such as for use in framed presentations.

attribute.name: type
attribute.info: Fully qualified Java class name of the bean to be created if no bean is found for the specified name and scope. To be used successfully with the Struts ActionServlet, this class must implement the org.apache.struts.action.ActionForm interface. [Runtime error if bean creation is attempted]

info.p: Renders an HTML <input> element of type hidden, populated from the specified value or the specified property of the bean associated with our current form. This tag is only valid when nested inside a form tag body.

attribute.name: name
attribute.info: The attribute name of the bean whose properties are consulted when rendering the current value of this input field. If not specified, the bean associated with the form tag we are nested within is utilized.

attribute.name: property
attribute.info: Name of this input field, and the name of the corresponding bean property if value is not specified. The corresponding bean property (if any) must be of type String.

attribute.name: value
attribute.info: Value to which this field should be initialized. [Use the corresponding bean property value]

info.p: Renders an HTML <input> element of type checkbox, whose "checked" status is initialized based on whether the specified value matches one of the elements of the underlying property's array of current values. This element is useful when you have large numbers of checkboxes, and prefer to combine the values into a single array-valued property instead of multiple boolean properties. This tag is only valid when nested inside a form tag body.

attribute.name: accesskey
attribute.info: The keyboard character used to move focus immediately to this element.

attribute.name: name
attribute.info: The attribute name of the bean whose properties are consulted when rendering the current value of this input field. If not specified, the bean associated with the form tag we are nested within is utilized.

attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses input focus.

attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses input focus and its value has changed.

attribute.name: onmouseup
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under the mouse pointer and a mouse button is released.

attribute.name: property
attribute.info: Name of the request parameter that will be included with this submission, set to the specified value.

attribute.name: style
attribute.info: CSS styles to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: tabindex
attribute.info: The tab order (ascending positive integers) for this element.

attribute.name: value
attribute.info: Value of the label to be placed on this button. This value will also be submitted as the value of the specified request parameter. [Body of this tag (if any), or "Cancel"]

info.p: Renders an HTML <option> element, representing one of the choices for a <select> element. The text displayed to the user comes from the body of this tag. If the value of the corresponding bean property matches the specified value, this option will be marked selected. This tag is only valid when nested inside a select tag body.

attribute.name: value
attribute.info: Value to be submitted for this field if this option is selected by the user.

tag.name: options
tag.summary: Render a Collection of Select Options

info.p: Renders a set of HTML <option> elements, representing possible choices for a <select> element. This tag can be used multiple times within a particular <struts:select> element, either in conjunction with or instead of one or more <struts:option> tags.
The collection of values actually selected depends on the presence or absence of the name and property attributes. The following combinations are allowed:

ul.li: Only name is specified - The value of this attribute is the name of a JSP bean in some scope that is the collection.
Only property is specified - The value of this attribute is the name of a property of the ActionForm bean associated with our form, which will return the collection.

Both name and property are specified - The value of the name attribute identifies a JSP bean in some scope. The value of the property attribute is the name of some property of that bean which will return the collection.

info.p: The collection of labels displayed to the user can be the same as the option values themselves, or can be different, depending on the presence or absence of the labelName and labelProperty attributes. If this feature is used, the collection of labels must contain the same number of elements as the corresponding collection of values. The following combinations are allowed:

ul.li: Neither labelName nor labelProperty is specified - The labels will be the same as the option values themselves.
Only labelName is specified - The value of this attribute is the name of a JSP bean in some scope that is the collection.
Only labelProperty is specified - The value of this attribute is the name of a property of the ActionForm bean associated with our form, which will return the collection.

Both labelName and labelProperty are specified - The value of the labelName attribute identifies a JSP bean in some scope. The value of the labelProperty attribute is the name of some property of that bean which will return the collection.

attribute.name: labelName
attribute.info: Name of the JSP bean (in some scope) containing the collection of labels to be displayed to the user for these options.

attribute.name: labelProperty
attribute.info: Property of the form bean, or the bean specified by the labelName attribute, that will return the collection of labels to be displayed to the user for these options.

attribute.name: name
attribute.info: Name of the JSP bean (in some scope) containing the collection of values to be returned to the server for these options. If not specified, the form bean associated with our form is assumed.

attribute.name: property
attribute.info: Property of the form bean, or the bean specified by the name attribute, that will return the collection of values to returned to the server for these options.

tag.name: password
tag.info: Renders an HTML <input> element of type password, populated from the specified value or the specified property of the bean associated with our current form. This tag is only valid when nested inside a form tag body.

attribute.name: size
attribute.info: Number of character positions to allocate. [Browser default]

attribute.name: tabindex

attribute.info: Value of the label to be placed on this button. This value will also be submitted as the value of the specified request parameter. [Body of this tag (if any), or "Cancel"]

tag.name: select
tag.info: Custom tag that represents an HTML select element, associated with a bean property specified by our attributes. This tag must be nested inside a form tag.

attribute.name: accesskey
attribute.info: The keyboard character used to move focus immediately to this element.

attribute.name: multiple
attribute.info: If set to any arbitrary value, the rendered select element will support multiple selections.

attribute.name: name
attribute.info: The fully-qualified java class name of the bean containing the underlying property.

attribute.name: onblur
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses input focus.

attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses input focus and its value has changed.

tag.name: text
tag.summary: Render An Input Field of Type text
tag.info: Render an input button of type text.

attribute.name: accesskey
attribute.info: The keyboard character used to move focus immediately to this element.

attribute.name: name
attribute.info: The attribute name of the bean whose properties are consulted when rendering the current value of this input field. If not specified, the bean associated with the form tag we are nested within is utilized.

attribute.name: property
attribute.info: Name of this input field, and the name of the corresponding bean property if value is not specified. The corresponding bean property (if any) must be of type String.

attribute.name: value
attribute.info: Value to which this field should be initialized. [Use the corresponding bean property value]

attribute.name: maxlength
attribute.info: Maximum number of input characters to accept. [No limit]

attribute.name: size
attribute.info: Number of character positions to allocate. [Browser default]

attribute.name: onblur
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses input focus.

attribute.name: onchange
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses input focus and its value has changed.

attribute.name: onclick
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives a mouse click.

attribute.name: ondblclick
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives a mouse double click.

attribute.name: onfocus
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives input focus.

attribute.name: onkeydown
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and a key is depressed.

attribute.name: onkeypress
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and a key is depressed and released.

attribute.name: onkeyup
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and a key is released.

attribute.name: onmousedown
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under the mouse pointer and a mouse button is depressed.

attribute.name: onmousemove
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under the mouse pointer and the pointer is moved.

attribute.name: onmouseout
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element was under the mouse pointer but the pointer was moved outside the element.

attribute.name: onmouseover
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element was not under the mouse pointer but the pointer is moved inside the element.

attribute.name: onmouseup
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under the mouse pointer and a mouse button is released.

attribute.name: style
attribute.info: CSS styles to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: tabindex
attribute.info: The tab order (ascending positive integers) for this element.

attribute.name: accesskey
attribute.info: The keyboard character used to move focus immediately to this element.

attribute.name: cols
attribute.info: The number of columns to display.

attribute.name: name
attribute.info: The attribute name of the bean whose properties are consulted when rendering the current value of this input field. If not specified, the bean associated with the form tag we are nested within is utilized.

attribute.name: property
attribute.info: Name of this input field, and the name of the corresponding bean property if value is not specified. The corresponding bean property (if any) must be of type String.

attribute.name: value
attribute.info: Value to which this field should be initialized. [Use the corresponding bean property value]

attribute.name: onblur
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses input focus.

attribute.name: onchange
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses input focus and its value has changed.

attribute.name: onclick
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives a mouse click.

attribute.name: ondblclick
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives a mouse double click.

attribute.name: onfocus
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives input focus.

attribute.name: onkeydown
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and a key is depressed.

attribute.name: onkeypress
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and a key is depressed and released.

attribute.name: onkeyup
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and a key is released.

attribute.name: onmousedown
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under the mouse pointer and a mouse button is depressed.

attribute.name: onmousemove
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under the mouse pointer and the pointer is moved.

attribute.name: onmouseout
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element was under the mouse pointer but the pointer was moved outside the element.

attribute.name: onmouseover
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element was not under the mouse pointer but the pointer is moved inside the element.

attribute.name: onmouseup
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under the mouse pointer and a mouse button is released.

attribute.name: rows
attribute.info: The number of rows to display.

attribute.name: style
attribute.info: CSS styles to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: tabindex
attribute.info: The tab order (ascending positive integers) for this element.
